attributes.action: Teach Self-defense as a national curriculum
attributes.background: offer free self-defense lessons for free for children under the age of 18. This will possibly help with bullying and improve fitness

attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who order goods that are out of stock at the time.
attributes.background: Consumers currently have the right to a refund if unhappy with goods purchased online. They should have the same right when purchasing goods in a shop where the goods are out of stock at time of purchase; as with an Internet purchase, the consumer can't inspect the goods until they actually arrive.
attributes.additional_details: In the face-to-face scenario, it can happen that the goods are out of stock, the trader asks for payment prior to ordering the goods into stock, the trader receives the goods into stock, the consumer inspects the goods but is unhappy with them, then the trader refuses to refund the consumer’s money, forcing the consumer to either accept the goods or alternatively a credit note that may be of no use to the consumer.  I believe that consumers should have the right to a refund in this situation.

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: Make booking fees illegal where tickets are only available from one vendor
attributes.background: Ticketing websites regularly charge customers the added cost of a booking fee when using their services despite it often being only website on which tickets are available. This enables vendors to charge whatever price they want knowing if people want the tickets they must pay the charge.
attributes.additional_details: When using sites such as Ticketmaster there is the added cost of a booking fee with the purchase of tickets. In many cases the ticket is only available from this website allowing a monopoly over their sale, this in turn leaves customers open to exploitation as vendors can charge excessive booking fees under this monopoly. Under this proposal booking fees would be banned unless tickets for the same event were on sale elsewhere creating competition among ticket vendors to offer the best price.

attributes.action: The penalty for using a mobile phone while driving  1year ban and £500 fine.
attributes.background: Too many people are being injured and killed on our roads the present penalties are not a deterrent. Too many people are ignoring the issue.

attributes.action: No transfer of powers to councils to fine motorists for minor traffic offences
attributes.background: Town halls want to rake in more cash by securing sweeping new powers to impose fines on motorists for minor traffic offences.  The Local Government Association want government to transfer powers to them that are currently only available to the police.
attributes.additional_details: The Local Government Association have already started the process of lobbying government in the form of the Department of Transport.  They believe that they are better suited to this enforcement than the police.  This has already been rejected once, but they are continuing to put pressure on government for the change.  We already know that local government isn't about making things safer it's purely a revenue raising exercise and again the motorist is yet again being seen as a cash cow.

attributes.action: Make all school "Keep Clear" markings mandatory zones instead of advisory.
attributes.background: Too many people ignore the Keep Clear markings around school entrances as currently they are advisory unless accompanied by signage and enforced by the local Councils. Making them compulsory No Parking zones would make school entrances safer for all.

attributes.action: Ban credit checks for job applications
attributes.background: Most jobs now require credit checks. All of us have a past - should we be judged on our credit? does it affect our ability to work?
attributes.additional_details: The majority of people have at least one debt or more, especially trying to survive on benefits.

attributes.action: Form a public holiday to celebrate our NHS; incl. all in the emergency services
attributes.background:
The NHS is one of our key British Values.

A NHS Day holiday in the summer would serve to underscore our deep admiration for all of those who work in the health and emergency services. With events celebrating its formation, those that serve and events to promote health and community.
attributes.additional_details:
The NHS is, if anything, one of our key British Values. Given this, is it not time to truly celebrate the NHS!?!?
This would allow a focus of public opinion and need for such a critical part of who we are as a nation, showing the world that this is who we are and what we hold dearest to our hearts. If ever there was a time to show how strong we all feel about the NHS it's now. What better way to do that than a public holiday focused around celebrating this bedrock of our society!

attributes.action: Free residential or nursing care for everyone who fought during WW 2.
attributes.background: People who risked their lives for our country are now forced to give up everything to pay for their care.

attributes.action: Remove VAT from home insulation and damp proofing products.
attributes.background:
Home insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion are the top three most effective and simple means of reducing energy cost and emissions whilst improving environmental health.
Charging VAT on insulation, damp proofing and draught exclusion is hobbling those who do most to help the environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The laws of physics and the governments own agencies agree with the priorities for energy efficiency and reduction of environmental cost/ damage.
Removal of VAT would be the single, simplest and most effective action whilst avoiding the high administration cost of the more complex and corruptible schemes.

attributes.action: Require all schools to teach children about the severity of acid attacks.
attributes.background: We have recently seen increasing numbers in the amount of these life-changing acid attacks. For example, in 2012 the attack of Naomi Oni, who had acid chucked on her whilst walking through London. Since, 2012 acid attacks have doubled. It is vital that we educate children about this danger.
attributes.additional_details: Last year there were more than 450 acid attacks in London alone. Many have argued to make the sale of acids more regulated and that you should no longer to be able to 'buy it over the counter' however I do not think this is how we should tackle this problem. By further regulating the sale of acids we will not stop the problem directly, however by educating our youth on the effects of these life-changing attacks, we will hopefully see a decrease in the number of attacks in areas such as London.

attributes.action: Make Greyhound racing illegal in the U.K .
attributes.background: Greyhound racing must be banned in the U.K. This "sport" remains legal in 8 countries and one of them is the U.K. The sport is inhumane and over 10,000 greyhounds vanish/die every year. This is why we believe it has to stop . #YouBetTheyDie #NoGreyhoundRacing
attributes.additional_details: Greyhound racing is a popular industry here in the U.K. Beautiful dogs race at ground-scaring speeds; the thrill making quick quid off a brutal bet - this all entices many dog-racing enthusiasts, betters and gamblers alike. However, the reality is greyhound-racing is cruel and disgusting. Over 10,000 greyhounds a year are tossed aside due to being "useless". Around 8,000 of these are retired. These poor dogs are then left to starve, abandoned, murdered, sold for dissection purposes and worse.

attributes.action: Give adoption allowance to self employed people
attributes.background:
If you are employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity pay.
If you are employed and adopting a child you are entitled to adoption pay.
If you are self employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity allowance.
If you are self employed and adopting a child you are entitled to NOTHING!!
attributes.additional_details:
Please support people who are self employed and are wanting to provide a loving and stable home for a child in need.
The financial situation is very important in the adoption process as you need to be able to provide for a child emotionally and financially, no adoption allowance can stand in the way of prospective adoptive parents being approved.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Academic research funded by the taxpayer should be free to read
attributes.background: The Government funds the majority of the UK’s academic research with taxpayer money. The results of this research, academic papers, are not accessible to the public because publishers charge £40 to read an article that is given to them for free. The public should not have to pay twice for research.
attributes.additional_details: You wouldn't be charged to enter an NHS hospital, why should you be charged to enter science? The British public is paying for 66% of university research (see: http://goo.gl/dnhLfw), but only 37% of it is free to read (http://goo.gl/4asiU8). Researchers give profitable publishers like Elsevier their work for free and can be charged as much as $5000 to hand over their own work (http://goo.gl/7in7LR). The policy fix: "Publicly funded research must be publicly available". More: http://goo.gl/sk1Hfa

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Make it an offence to smoke inside private homes where children live
attributes.background: Parliament should extend the smoke-free workplace legislation to include private homes where children reside, provide for deterrent sentences upon conviction and a fixed penalty scheme, raise awareness via the school curriculum and provide a helpline for children to report offenders.

attributes.action: Keep the Panavia Tornado in service for another few years
attributes.background: The Tornado is one of the most capable and advanced strike aircraft currently fielded by any air force today, and RAF Tornados are currently conducting airstrikes on insurgents in the Middle East, and the Tornado will be kept in service by Germany until 2025, so why can’t we?

attributes.action: Require winter tyres on all vehicles from 1st November to 31st March each year
attributes.background: Reduce risk of accidents on roads in winter conditions. Motorists stuck on the motorways in winter like on the M74 16th-17th Jan 2018 less likely. Uncleared roads generally still passable. Makes the roads safer for those who use winter tyres already.

attributes.action: Restore expatriate Pensioners in Spain their Winter Fuel Allowance.
attributes.background: Expat Pensioners have paid into the system and require parity with Pensioners in the UK. If it is right for UK residents it must be right for Spanish expatriates to receive their allowance.
attributes.additional_details: When the temperatures drop in winter, as they do in the UK, pensioners in Spain need to burn wood to keep their homes warm - homes that have been designed to remain cold in summer become very cold in winter. A great many pensioners are not wealthy but just about surviving on their meagre pension income. The seasonal temperature variation can be as much as 50 + centrigade with the temperatures falling below 0 degrees centigrade when the Sun sets in the Winter season.

attributes.action: All new build homes built in the last 5 years to be granted freehold interest.
attributes.background: Adverse publicity of developers including unreasonable clauses within leases on new houses has led to government consultation.  Developers should not hold power over new home buyers upon legal completion of the house.  People who buy a new build house want to be freeholders not tenants!

attributes.action: Help single parents into work by funding childcare for all ages during holidays
attributes.background: It is really hard for single parents to work during summer holidays due to the government not funding childcare for all ages, only funding for children under 5 if you spread you nursery hours throughout the year. It is near impossible for a single parent of children under 10 to work 30 hours a week.

attributes.action: Make 'traffic light' food/drink labelling legally compulsory in the UK.
attributes.background:
One often reads, hears or sees in the news these days that obesity levels in the UK
have reached pandemic proportions,
leading to concerns about the risk of heart disease and diabetes, among other serious and life-changing illnesses.
attributes.additional_details: A big contributing factor is the amount of excess fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar consumed by the average UK citizen on a daily basis. There is a clear system available called the "traffic lights", whereby food and drink items can be rated using red (high), amber (medium) and green (low) images to simply and clearly indicate how much fat, saturated fat, salt and sugar are contained in 100 grams or 100 millilitres of an item. As I understand it use of the traffic lights is currently voluntary.

attributes.action: Remove variable speed cameras or only put them in action for emergencies
attributes.background: The removal of the variable speed cameras would cut congestion dramatically it will also prevent as many crashes in these areas from people slamming their brakes on when they approach a ridiculous 40mph
attributes.additional_details: When the cameras have been off over Christmas no traffic at all on the m4 past Newport at the same time when the cameras are in action you can expect tailbacks that also cause high emissions from stop start traffic caused by these variable limits they should either be removed or only used if there are lanes blocked

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel

attributes.action: Increase the amount of money that a person signed off work on sick pay receives.
attributes.background: I'm currently receiving sick pay of £360 a month, due to being hit by a car off my motorcycle by a car driver resulting in breaking my shoulder. The £360 a month that i receive soon disappears due to bills and it's very hard to live off of this amount of money a month, when i physically cannot work.
attributes.additional_details: I'm creating this petition to help others in my situation, who physically cannot work due to a motor vehicle accident. Crashes, accidents and injuries sometimes cannot be helped, if you've been injured from the same case to mine or one similar, why should the injured party suffer due to carelessness of another person? It's certainly not fair that the injured party has to live off of £360 a month when the other person can go back to work and earn their standard living wages a month.

attributes.action: Ban import of all Burmese products to the UK
attributes.background:
Discriminatory government policies and militry violance in Mayanmar have compelled 600,000 Rohingya's to fled their homes to Bangladesh.

Violations of human rights, including burning villages, killings, raping, torturing women & children, ethnically cleansing Burma of Rohingya population.
attributes.additional_details:
Rohingya are Muslim minority group. They differ from Myanmar’s dominant Buddhist groups ethnically, linguistically, and religiously.

The government refuses to grant the Rohingya citizenship, as a result they have no legal documentation, effectively making them stateless. Myanmar’s 1948 citizenship law was already exclusionary, and the military junta, which seized power in 1962, introduced a law twenty years later stripping the Rohingya of access to full citizenship.

attributes.action: Retest EVERY driver every 10 years when photo card licence needs to be renewed.
attributes.background:
Currently, driving licences last until the holder reaches 70 years, but the photograph on their licence must be updated every 10 years. 
As an Approved Driving Instructor (ADI) I have to be re-tested every so-often to prove that I am "up to standard". Why not apply the same rule to all drivers?
attributes.additional_details: Driving licence photos must be renewed every 10 years. MANY drivers say "I couldn't pass my test again". We (ADI's) are required to teach "safe driving for life". Rules change. Signs change. Road layouts change. Change the licence requirements. DVSA could call the renewing licence holder for a "check" free of charge. If the licence holder passes their check DVLA will issue a renewed licence. If the holder fails the check their licence would be suspended until they pay for each check and pass.

attributes.action: Adopt a stance of permanent military neutrality, as a nation state.
attributes.background: Military intervention has been largely unpopular and entirely ineffective at ending the issues it claims plague the world. Conquest is forbidden as a peremptory norm, aggression is mostly too. Self defense implies neutrality, saving 1-1.5% of GDP each year to spend on other sectors of the economy.
attributes.additional_details:
Since the time of the Peace of Westphalia, the military has lost two of its three purposes. Internal revolt and crime being dealt with by local police forces, the right of conquest being outlawed per jus cogens, only self defense remains. Neutrality is a natural and rational position when self defense is the only legal use of arms. 

Largely, neutral countries such as Switzerland, Austria, Ireland, Finland spend 0.5-1% of GDP on their militaries. That equates to £20-30bn in savings per year.

attributes.action: Stop councils having to pay when planning decisions are overturned on appeal
attributes.background: Having spoken to local councillors it would appear the councils are becoming unwilling to deny planning because of the costs involved if overturned at appeal. This needs to stop or will end up with councils unwilling to do their best for the people, purely based on money.
attributes.additional_details: I feel the need to ask this question having been witness to the completely inappropriate and ill advised project to double the size of a small village in North Warwickshire.

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ban cyclists to ride on dual carriageways.
attributes.background: To cycle is a good activity to keep you fit and to impact less on the environment. The problem arises when a cyclist decides to take a ride on a dual carriageway: with motorised vehicles going as fast as 70mph the likelihood of an accident are high, especially at night.

attributes.action: All England, Scotland and Wales national team games available on freeview TV
attributes.background: I am English and I want to see my national team play.  I follow Rugby Union but I am unable to see live coverage of England games during the Rugby Union autumn international tests because I have to subscribe to SKY.

attributes.action: Council Right To Build
attributes.background: We are calling upon the Government to grant Local Authorities the right to build and the right to buy so that housing can be let to families on low incomes at social housing rents. If the Government target of building 300,000 new homes is to be achieved, councils will have to play their part.
attributes.additional_details:
Local Authority resources are stretched to breaking point. This government has acknowledged our widespread housing crisis, but still the wait goes on for tangible action to get housebuilders building genuinely affordable homes.

The last time that 300,000 homes were built in one year in England was in 1969, when councils and housing associations were also building new homes. The private sector has never and does not have the inclination to reach these numbers.

attributes.action: Make Falconry in the UK licensed.
attributes.background:
Here in the UK, we are one of the only countries in the world, that does not have a falconry license.
There is a huge issue where anyone can own and breed and sell birds of prey, to people who have no experience. 
I encounter 10-12 owls and Hawks each year kept in parrot cages and rabbit hutches
attributes.additional_details:
There's 1000s of people who have birds of prey, some of these birds can kill animals up the the size of deer, so effectively they're equivalent to a dangerous weapon. 
There needs to be control on the ownership or at the least, a strict mentoring system.

attributes.action: Ban vans parking and blocking views of crossings&driveways
attributes.background: Van drivers don’t realise that parking where they do can cause view of drivers pulling off of driveways and people waiting to cross and bus stops etc

attributes.action: To be compulsory for dog owners to muzzle their dogs if using extendable lead
attributes.background: A cat on my street was sleeping on his windowsill an elderly lady came onto the street with her dog on one of these leads. The dog was at least 15ft in front of lady went between a car saw the cat and fatally attacked and killed the cat, because she didn't have full control of her animal.

attributes.action: Abolish business rates and replace with business rates transaction charge
attributes.background: Internet based companies have an unfair competitive advantage over traditional bricks and mortar retailers who have to pay business rates.  These disproportionate business rates are contributing towards the demise and failure of the local high street.   Help redress the imbalance for all retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
A 0.5% business rates charge levied on the sales value of each transaction would be a fair arrangement and would be linked directly to the success of a retail business. 
Since most sales transactions for online and high street retailers are by credit card, the collection mechanism is already in place.  The credit card holder’s physical location or credit card address is readily available for government’s re-distribution to the local authorities.

attributes.action: Protect private companies and pension funds by closing Companies Act loopholes.
attributes.background: Under s172 Companies Act 2006, directors must "promote the success of the company" taking into account the long term consequences and the need to act fairly with stakeholders, such as employees.  However, Part 23 of the Act fails to prevent the asset-stripping of companies by the unscrupulous.
attributes.additional_details:
Accumulative distributable reserves should be restricted to cover the current pension fund deficit before further distributions are considered. 

Fixed assets should be recorded at fair value before assets are transferred out of the company and the non-distributable revaluation reserve created should remain with the company.

Non-distributable reserves converted to distributable reserves should be accounted for as unrealized profit for dividend purposes and not appropriated from the company.

attributes.action: Replace credit card commission to businesses with flat fees per transaction
attributes.background: The government announced recently that businesses are no longer able to charge commission on credit card payments. However, credit card companies can still levy commission on businesses. This is damaging to many businesses, especially as commissions vary, so we must introduce fixed fees instead.
attributes.additional_details:
More people will use a credit card rather than a debit card now there is no commission to pay. This is to be expected, after all, the money is better in their account for a month, but the cost to business is unjust.
The cost for debit card transactions is around 15p per transaction. 
For £100,000 worth of transactions at an average of £50, this would equate to £300. 
For credit cards this could be between £1,500 and £2,000. There is no justification for such excess so please help to stop it.

attributes.action: Referenda enacted by a UK nation must allow citizens born in that nation a vote.
attributes.background: If a UK nation considers a referendum about independence from the union, or a related topic that affects the stability of that union, then voters born in that nation, and who are citizens of the UK residing within the UK, must be able to vote on the referendum topic.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Independence Referendum of 2014 refused the vote to citizens of the UK born in Scotland, but who resided in another nation of the UK. Since this would likely impact their citizenship (stateless?) and ability to work, they should be able to vote.

This is a general petition, and is not specific to a future Scottish Referendum. Any citizen of the UK, born in a UK nation (Northern Ireland, Wales, Scotland, England) where their birth-Nation has a referendum, should be able to vote.

attributes.action: Stop employers referring to contracted hours employment as a "minimum".
attributes.background: In many contracts, (especially in retail), the hours expected for an employee to work are stated as a "minimum". This wording, in effect, allows the employer to require you to work above your minimum working hours without having to pay you overtime.
attributes.additional_details: The wording of all employment contracts should be absolutely clear as to the expected working hours of the employment. There should be no ambiguity to allow the employer to achieve "free labour" from the technical wording of their contract. If an employer requires an employee to work hours in excess of their contract, this should be reimbursed through overtime payments.

attributes.action: Add American Football to the curriculum
attributes.background: Although American Football is not common in the U.K. Just yet, it is growing into interest to many people. However many people are restricted from playing it as there are very few clubs and no schools I know of includes American Football in there education.
attributes.additional_details: There are many benefits of playing American Football. The best thing about American Football is that anyone and everyone can play it as size doesn't matter. In fact being slightly overweight or being skinny can actually benefit to many people's attention. Many people think that American Football is a very rough sport but this is not true. You have contact American Football and you have Flag American Football meaning that if you play the flagged version there will be no contact meaning no harm

attributes.action: Make Legal Provision for Northwest Regions of the UK to hold a Legal Referendum.
attributes.background: The referendum will give all citizens in the North a chance to vote on uniting UK Northern Regions to form an autonomous independent country breaking away from the South & the UK Government with Manchester as a Northern Capital with an elected Minister best placed to serve the citizens of N/England.
attributes.additional_details: Northern citizens suffer from lower life expectancy, lack of investment in areas such as education, health, skilled training and quality employment opportunities. Lack of political influence in London/South effects the Norths capability for economic growth. The neglect in these  areas is at such an extent that the North & South could be viewed as separate countries already. (One Example) IPPR thinktank, DT infrastructure spending 2016/17 London £1,943 per person, Northwest Region £680pp.

attributes.action: Stop Parliamentary recess for Party Annual Conferences
attributes.background: I passionately believe the Parliament of the United Kingdom fails to serve the country efficiently as it is 'closed' too often and for excessive periods. If Party Conferences are necessary they should be held during summer recess or another recess period.

attributes.action: Add a coat of arms to the Union Flag, to better represent all nations of the U.K
attributes.background: Though iconic, the flag's design doesn't represent all of the United Kingdom. There is historical context for the omission of Wales, but if we truly are a Union of four countries, we need to show that to the world. Adding a coat of arms with four national symbols would be small, but significant.
attributes.additional_details:
In these times, the importance of the Union has been highlighted by figures across the political spectrum. 

Adding a small coat of arms to the Union Flag comprising of four symbols for each of the nations (Wales, Scotland, Northern Ireland and England), would not change the issues the Union faces. But it might help restore confidence, and finally give Wales visual representation. 

It would be seen internationally, as well. A reminder, to us and to the world, that we are four nations - united.

attributes.action: The UK to urge the UN to add Catalonia as a non-self-governing territory.
attributes.background: The UN charter defines a Non-Self-Governing Territory (NSGT) as one “whose people have not yet attained a full measure of self-government”. Given the recent actions of the Spanish regime, as permanent member of the UNSC the UK should urge that Catalonia be added to the NSGT list maintained by the UN
attributes.additional_details: Catalonia has a unique language, culture and ethnicity. Between 1930 and 1970 Spain as a state committed various violent repressions on the Catalonians and restricted their culture, language and identity. The Spanish terrorists who did this were formally pardoned by Madrid. Currently the Catalonians are expressing their right to self-determination through a peaceful referendum, which has been violently banned by the Spanish regime.

attributes.action: change workplace drugs tests. Oral mouth swabs should be the compulsory method.
attributes.background: Urine based testing is a demeaning and very personal method of testing. Oral mouth swabs is a easy and non-invasive method. It is the method used by police for road users and should be made the compulsory method for the workplace.
attributes.additional_details: Oral mouth swabs has the ability to detect drug use within the first few hours. This is a window of time that is omitted by urine tests. Mouth swabs, with their ability to detect drug use 1-4 days after use, are the best method for impairment and post-accident testing.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of Angora rabbit fur products in the UK
attributes.background: Angora rabbit fur is often harvested from live rabbits. Their legs are stretched and pinned down while their fur is ripped out leaving them to scream helplessly in pain. Its an inhumane and cruel practice that we must make a stand against.
attributes.additional_details: Britain should make a stand against and the Angora fur trade to demonstrate cruelly harvested products are not tolerated. The unethical practice of removal of rabbit fur in China has recently been highlighted by People for the Unethical Treatment of Animals (PETA.) Their graphic evidence is featured on their website. The rabbits are kept in disgusting conditions and subjected to abuse that is beyond words.

attributes.action: Set a legal maximum stake of £2 for fixed odds betting machines (FOBTS)
attributes.background:
Problem gamblers are often troubled, vulnerable and in self-destruct mode. An addict desires to burn quickly - the 'crack-cocaine' FOBT machines facilitate this

B2 gaming/roulette can take £100 in seconds. There should be a legal maximum stake of £2 to protect people who are addicted to gambling.
attributes.additional_details:
Betting can be fun, but addiction isn't.
 
When the fun stops, stop. The fun has stopped - there are over 400,000 problem gamblers, with more than 2 million 'at risk' - so stop the FOBTs.
 
A £2 maximum stake (as already is in place on b3 games/ 'slots') would still allow serious, but stable gamblers to  win big, but not on the 'crack-cocaine' of gambling. 

We call on the Government to take this action to protect vulnerable people and to fix the problem in gambling.
